an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. Otherwise, finish current task by Plan.finish_current_task explicitly.\n3. Each time you finish a task, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to report your progress.\n4. Don\'t forget to append task first when all existing tasks are finished and new tasks are required.\n5. Avoid repeating tasks you have already completed. And end loop when all requirements are met.\nYou are an autonomous programmer\n\nThe special interface consists of a file editor that shows you 100 lines of a file at a time.\n\nYou can use terminal commands (e.g., cat, ls, cd) by calling Terminal.run_command.\n\nYou should carefully observe the behavior and results of the previous action, and avoid triggering repeated errors.\n\nIn addition to the terminal, I also provide additional tools. \n\nIf provided an issue link, you first action must be navigate to the issue page using Browser tool to understand the issue.\n\nYour must check if the repository exists at the current path. If it exists, navigate to the repository path. If the repository doesn\'t exist, please download it and then navigate to it.\nAll subsequent actions must be performed within this repository path. Do not leave this directory to execute any actions at any time.\n\nNote:\n\n1. If you open a file and need to get to an area around a specific line that is not in the first 100 lines, say line 583, don\'t just use the scroll_down command multiple times. Instead, use the Editor.goto_line command. It\'s much quicker. \n2. Always make sure to look at the currently open file and the current working directory (which appears right after the currently open file). The currently open file might be in a different directory than the working directory! Note that some commands, such as \'create\', open files, so they might change the current open file.\n3. When using Editor.edit_file_by_replace, if there is no exact match, take the difference in indentation into consideration.\n4. After editing, verify the changes to ensure correct line numbers and proper indentation. Adhere to PEP8 standards for Python code.\n5. NOTE ABOUT THE EDIT COMMAND: Indentation really matters! When editing a file, make sure to insert appropriate indentation before each line! Ensuring the code adheres to PEP8 standards. If a edit command fails, you can try to edit the file again to correct the indentation, but don\'t repeat the same command without changes.\n6. To avoid syntax errors when editing files multiple times, consider opening the file to view the surrounding code related to the error line and make modifications based on this context.\n7. Ensure to observe the currently open file and the current working directory, which is displayed right after the open file. The open file might be in a different directory than the working directory. Remember, commands like \'create\' open files and might alter the current open file.\n8. Effectively using Use search commands (`search_dir`, `search_file`, `find_file`) and navigation commands (`open_file`, `goto_line`) to locate and modify files efficiently. The Editor tool can fully satisfy the requirements. Follow these steps and considerations for optimal results:\n\n9. When the edit fails, try to enlarge the range of code.\n10. You must use the Editor.open_file command to open a file before using the Editor tool\'s edit command to modify it. When you open a file, any currently open file will be automatically closed.\n11. Remember, when you use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the line numbers will change after the operation. Therefore, if there are multiple operations, perform only the first operation in the current response, and defer the subsequent operations to the next turn.\n11.1 Do not use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace more than once per command list.\n12. If you choose Editor.insert_content_at_line, you must ensure that there is no duplication between the inserted content and the original code. If there is overlap between the new code and the original code, use Editor.edit_file_by_replace instead.\n13. If you choose Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the original code that needs to be replaced must start at the beginning of the line and end at the end of the line\n14. When not specified, you should write files in a folder named "{project_name}_1766905517". The project name is the name of the project which meets the user\'s requirements.\n15. When provided system design or project schedule, you MUST read them first before making a plan, then adhere to them in your implementation, especially in the programming language, package, or framework. You MUST implement all code files prescribed in the system design or project schedule.\n16. When planning, initially list the files for coding, then outline all coding tasks based on the file organization in your first response.\n17. If you plan to read a file, do not include other plans in the same response.\n18. Write only one code file each time and provide its full implementation.\n19. When the requirement is simple, you don\'t need to create a plan, just do it right away.\n20. When using the editor, pay attention to current directory. When you use editor tools, the paths must be either absolute or relative to the editor\'s current directory.\n21. When planning, consider whether images are needed. If you are developing a showcase website, start by using ImageGetter.get_image to obtain the necessary images.\n22. When planning, merge multiple tasks that operate on the same file into a single task. For example, create one task for writing unit tests for all functions in a class. Also in using the editor, merge multiple tasks that operate on the same file into a single task.\n23. When create unit tests for a code file, use Editor.read() to read the code file before planing. And create one plan to writing the unit test for the whole file.\n24. The priority to select technology stacks: Describe in Sytem Design and Project Schedule > Vite, React, MUI and Tailwind CSS > native HTML \n24.1. The React template is in the "/home///baselines/MetaGPT/template/react_template" and Vue template is in the "/home///baselines/MetaGPT/template/vue_template". \n25.  }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if preconditions for the use case are met.\n     * Preconditions:\n     * 1. " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")" + \n                                   (isAssigned ? " [Currently Assigned]" : ""));\n                i++;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nInstructions:");\n        System.out.println("1. Select roles to assign or remove (by ID or name)");\n        System.out.println("2. Click \'Send\' button to apply changes");\n        System.out.println("====================================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Process role assignments and removals (System action 4 from use case).\n     * This method handles the actual assignment and removal of roles based on administrator selection.\n     * \n     * @param targetUser The user to modify roles for\n     * @param rolesToAssign Set of roles to assign to the user\n     * @param rolesToRemove Set of roles to remove from the user\n     * @return true if operation successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean processRoleChanges(User targetUser, Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        if (targetUser == null) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Target user is null.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if administrator is logged in and has permissions\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Administrator not logged in.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!smosServerConnected) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Not connected to SMOS server.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Processing role changes for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        // Remove roles first to avoid conflicts\n        int removedCount = 0;\n        if (rolesToRemove != null && !rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            removedCount = targetUser.removeRoles(rolesToRemove);\n            System.out.println("Removed " + removedCount + " role(s) from user.");\n        }\n        \n        // Assign new roles\n        int assignedCount = 0;\n        if (rolesToAssign != null && !rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            assignedCount = targetUser.assignRoles(rolesToAssign);\n            System.out.println("Assigned " + assignedCount + " role(s) to user.");\n        }\n        \n        // Display final state\n        System.out.println("User now has " + targetUser.getRoleCount() + " role(s) assigned.");\n        \n        // " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n                index++;\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display all available roles in the system.\n     */\n    private void displayAvailableRoles() {\n        System.out.println("Available roles in the system:");\n        \n        if (availableRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("  No roles available in the system.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        int index = 1;\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n            boolean isAssigned = userRoles.contains(role);\n            String status = isAssigned ? "[ASSIGNED]" : "[AVAILABLE]";\n            System.out.println("  " + index + ". " + role.getRoleName() + \n                             " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ") " + status);\n            index++;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get roles that the administrator wants to assign to the user.\n     * \n     * @return Set of roles to assign\n     */\n    private Set<Role> getRolesToAssign() {\n        Set<Role> rolesToAssign = new HashSet<>();\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nEnter roles to ASSIGN (by ID, separated by commas, or \'none\' for none):");\n        System.out.print("Selection: ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("none") || input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles selected for assignment.");\n            return rolesToAssign;\n        }\n        \n        String[] roleIds = input.split(",");\n        for (String roleId : roleIds) {\n            roleId = roleId.trim();\n            if (!roleId.isEmpty()) {\n                Role role = findRoleById(roleId);\n                if (role != null) {\n                    // Check if role is already assigned\n                    if (targetUser.hasRole(role)) {\n                        System.out.println("  Note: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + "\' is already assigned to the user.");\n                    } else {\n                        rolesToAssign.add(role);\n                        System.out.println("  Selected to assign: " + role.getRoleName());\n                    }\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("  Warning: Role with ID \'" + roleId + "\' not found.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return rolesToAssign;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get roles that the administrator wants to remove from the user.\n     * \n     * @return Set of roles to remove\n     */\n    private Set<Role> getRolesToRemove() {\n        Set<Role> rolesToRemove = new HashSet<>();\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        if (userRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("User has no roles to remove.");\n            return rolesToRemove;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nEnter roles to REMOVE (by ID, separated by commas, or \'none\' for none):");\n        System.out.print("Selection: ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("none") || input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles selected for removal.");\n            return rolesToRemove;\n        }\n        \n        String[] roleIds = input.split(",");\n        for (String roleId : roleIds) {\n            roleId = roleId.trim();\n            if (!roleId.isEmpty()) {\n                Role role = findRoleById(roleId);\n                if (role != null) {\n                    if (userRoles.contains(role)) {\n                        rolesToRemove.add(role);\n                        System.out.println("  Selected to remove: " + role.getRoleName());\n                    } else {\n                        System.out.println("  Note: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + "\' is not currently assigned to the user.");\n                    }\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("  Warning: Role with ID \'" + roleId + "\' not found.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return rolesToRemove;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Find a role by its ID in the available roles set.\n     * \n     * @param roleId The role ID to find\n     * @return The Role object if found, null otherwise\n     */\n    private Role findRoleById(String roleId) {\n        for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n            if (role.getRoleId().equals(roleId)) {\n                return role;\n            }\n        }\n        return null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Confirm the role selections with the administrator.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles selected for assignment\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles selected for removal\n     * @return true if administrator confirms, false if cancels\n     */\n    private boolean confirmSelections(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Confirm Changes ---");\n        System.out.println("Summary of changes for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        if (rolesToAssign.isEmpty() && rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No changes to make.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Roles to ASSIGN:");\n            for (Role role : rolesToAssign) {\n                System.out.println("  + " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (!rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Roles to REMOVE:");\n            for (Role role : rolesToRemove) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nConfirm these changes? (yes/no): ");\n        String response = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        return response.equalsIgnoreCase("yes") || response.equalsIgnoreCase("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Process the role changes based on administrator selections.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles to assign\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles to remove\n     * @return true if changes were successfully processed, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean processRoleChanges(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Processing Role Changes ---");\n        \n        // Remove conflicting roles (roles both assigned and removed)\n        Set<Role> conflicts = new HashSet<>(rolesToAssign);\n        conflicts.retainAll(rolesToRemove);\n        \n        if (!conflicts.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: The following roles are both assigned and removed:");\n            for (Role role : conflicts) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n            System.out.println("These roles will be processed as REMOVALS only.");\n            \n            // Remove conflicts from assignment list\n            rolesToAssign.removeAll(conflicts);\n        }\n        \n        // Process removals first\n        int removedCount = 0;\n        if (!rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            removedCount = targetUser.removeRoles(rolesToRemove);\n            System.out.println("Successfully removed " + removedCount + " role(s).");\n        }\n        \n        // Process assignments\n        int assignedCount = 0;\n        if (!rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            assignedCount = targetUser.assignRoles(rolesToAssign);\n            System.out.println("Successfully assigned " + assignedCount + " role(s).");\n        }\n        \n        // Display final result\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Final Result ---");\n        System.out.println("User: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("Total roles now assigned: " + targetUser.getRoleCount());\n        \n        Set<Role> finalRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        if (!finalRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Assigned roles:");\n            for (Role role : finalRoles) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Simulate the "Send" button action from the use case\n        System.out.println("\\n[SIMULATION] \'Send\' button clicked - changes applied successfully.");\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Close the form and release resources.\n     */\n    public void closeForm() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n        System.out.println("Role management form closed.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validate that the role selections are valid (no duplicates in assignment,\n     * roles to remove are actually assigned, etc.).\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles selected for assignment\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles selected for removal\n     * @return true if selections are valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean validateSelections(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        // Check for roles to remove that aren\'t actually assigned\n        for (Role role : rolesToRemove) {\n            if (!userRoles.contains(role)) {\n                System.err.println("Validation error: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + \n                                 "\' is not assigned to the user and cannot be removed.");\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Check for roles that would be both assigned and removed\n        Set<Role> intersection = new HashSet<>(rolesToAssign);\n        intersection.retainAll(rolesToRemove);\n        if (!intersection.isEmpty()) {\n            System.err.println("Validation error: The following roles are both assigned and removed:");\n            for (Role role : intersection) {\n                System.err.println("  - " + role.getRoleName());\n            }\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulate the form display without user interaction (for automated testing).\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Pre-determined roles to assign\n     * @param rolesToRemove Pre-determined roles to remove\n     * @return true if changes were successfully processed, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean simulateFormSubmission(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n*** Automated Form Submission ***");\n        System.out.println("Managing roles for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        if (!validateSelections(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove)) {\n            System.err.println("Form submission failed: Invalid role selections.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Process the changes\n        return administrator.processRoleChanges(targetUser, rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the target user of this form.\n     * \n     * @return The target user\n     */\n    public User getTargetUser() {\n        return targetUser;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the available roles for this form.\n     * \n     * @return Set of available roles\n     */\n    public Set<Role> getAvailableRoles() {\n        return new HashSet<>(availableRoles);\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': '\n# Past Experience\n<experience>\n\n# Tool State\nThe current editor state is:\n(Current directory: /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/assign_remove_roles_1766905517)\n(Open file: /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/assign_remove_roles_1766905517/Administrator.java)\n\n# Current Plan\n[GOAL] [Message] from Mike to Alex: Write a complete Java program based on the provided use case \'Assign/RemoveRolesToAUser\'. The new_content must be a complete block of code. Example 1: Given a file \\"/workspace/example.txt\\" with the following content: ``` 001|contain f 002|contain g 003|contain h 004|contain i ``` EDITING: If you want to replace line 2 and line 3 edit_file_by_replace( \\"/workspace/example.txt\\", first_replaced_line_number=2, first_replaced_line_content=\\"contain g\\", last_replaced_line_number=3, last_replaced_line_content=\\"contain h\\", new_content=\\"new content\\", ) This will replace the second line 2 and line 3 with \\"new content\\". The resulting file will be: ``` 001|contain f 002|new content 003|contain i ``` Example 2: Given a file \\"/workspace/example.txt\\" with the following content: ``` 001|contain f 002|contain g 003|contain h 004|contain i ``` EDITING: If you want to remove the line 2 and line 3. edit_file_by_replace( \\"/workspace/example.txt\\", first_replaced_line_number=2, first_replaced_line_content=\\"contain g\\", last_replaced_line_number=3, last_replaced_line_content=\\"contain h\\", new_content=\\"\\", ) This will remove line 2 and line 3. The resulting file will be: ``` 001|contain f 002| 003|contain i ``` ", "signature": "(self, file_name: str, first_replaced_line_number: int, first_replaced_line_content: str, last_replaced_line_number: int, last_replaced_line_content: str, new_content: str) -> str", "parameters": "Args: file_name (str): The name of the file to edit. first_replaced_line_number (int): The line number to start the edit at, starting from 1. first_replaced_line_content (str): The content of the start replace line, according to the first_replaced_line_number. last_replaced_line_number (int): The line number to end the edit at (inclusive), starting from 1. last_replaced_line_content (str): The content of the end replace line, according to the last_replaced_line_number. new_content (str): The text to replace the current selection with, must conform to PEP8 standards. The content in the start line and end line will also be replaced."}, "find_file": {"type": "function", "description": "Finds all files with the given name in the specified directory. That is, the new content will start at the beginning of the specified line, and the existing content of that line will be moved down. This operation will NOT modify the content of the lines before or after the given line number. This function can not insert content the end of the file. Please use append_file instead, For example, if the file has the following content: ``` 001|contain g 002|contain h 003|contain i 004|contain j ``` and you call insert_content_at_line( file_name=\'file.txt\', line_number=2, insert_content=\'new line\' ) the file will be updated to: ``` 001|contain g 002|new line 003|contain h 004|contain i 005|contain j ``` ", "signature": "(self, file_name: str, line_number: int, insert_content: str) -> str", "parameters": "Args: file_name: (str): The name of the file to edit. line_number (int): The line number (starting from 1) to insert the content after. an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. (postcondition for the use case).\n     */\n    public void logout() {\n        isLoggedIn = false;\n        System.out.println("Administrator " + adminName + " logged out.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Connect to SMOS server (required for the use case).\n     * \n     * @return true if connection successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean connectToSmosServer() {\n        // Simulate SMOS server connection\n        smosServerConnected = true;\n        System.out.println("Connected to SMOS server.");\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Disconnect from SMOS server (postcondition for the use case).\n     */\n    public void disconnectFromSmosServer() {\n        smosServerConnected = false;\n        System.out.println("Disconnected from SMOS server.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if preconditions for the use case are met.\n     * Preconditions:\n     * 1. The user is logged in as an administrator\n     * 2. The user has carried out the case of use "viewdetTailsente" and the system is viewing the details of a user\n     * 3. The user click on the "User Roles" button\n     * \n     * @param targetUser The user whose details are being viewed\n     * @return true if all preconditions are met, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean checkPreconditions(User targetUser) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.err.println("Precondition failed: Administrator is not logged in.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!smosServerConnected) {\n            System.err.println("Precondition failed: Not connected to SMOS server.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (targetUser == null) {\n            System.err.println("Precondition failed: No user details are being viewed.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Simulate that "viewdetTailsente" use case has been carried out\n        System.out.println("Preconditions met: Admin is logged in, SMOS server connected, and viewing details of user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("User clicked on \'User Roles\' button.");\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the role management form (System action 1 from use case).\n     * This simulates displaying available roles for assignment/removal.\n     * \n     * @param availableRoles Set of all available roles in the system\n     * @param userRoles Set of roles currently assigned to the user\n     */\n    public void displayRoleManagementForm(Set<Role> availableRoles, Set<Role> userRoles) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Role Management Form ===");\n        System.out.println("Available roles in the system:");\n        \n        if (availableRoles == null || availableRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles available in the system.");\n        } else {\n            int i = 1;\n            for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n                boolean isAssigned = userRoles.contains(role);\n                System.out.println(i + ". " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")" + \n                                   (isAssigned ? " [Currently Assigned]" : ""));\n                i++;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nInstructions:");\n        System.out.println("1. Select roles to assign or remove (by ID or name)");\n        System.out.println("2. Click \'Send\' button to apply changes");\n        System.out.println("====================================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Process role assignments and removals (System action 4 from use case).\n     * This method handles the actual assignment and removal of roles based on administrator selection.\n     * \n     * @param targetUser The user to modify roles for\n     * @param rolesToAssign Set of roles to assign to the user\n     * @param rolesToRemove Set of roles to remove from the user\n     * @return true if operation successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean processRoleChanges(User targetUser, Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        if (targetUser == null) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Target user is null.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if administrator is logged in and has permissions\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Administrator not logged in.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!smosServerConnected) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Not connected to SMOS server.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Processing role changes for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        // Remove roles first to avoid conflicts\n        int removedCount = 0;\n        if (rolesToRemove != null && !rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            removedCount = targetUser.removeRoles(rolesToRemove);\n            System.out.println("Removed " + removedCount + " role(s) from user.");\n        }\n        \n        // Assign new roles\n        int assignedCount = 0;\n        if (rolesToAssign != null && !rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            assignedCount = targetUser.assignRoles(rolesToAssign);\n            System.out.println("Assigned " + assignedCount + " role(s) to user.");\n        }\n        \n        // Display final state\n        System.out.println("User now has " + targetUser.getRoleCount() + " role(s) assigned.");\n        \n        // Postcondition: User roles are modified\n        System.out.println("Postcondition satisfied: User roles have been modified.");\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Execute the complete use case "Assign/RemoveRolesToAUser".\n     * This method simulates the entire workflow described in the use case.\n     * \n     * @param targetUser The user to assign/remove roles for\n     * @param availableRoles All available roles in the system\n     * @param selectedRolesToAssign Roles selected by admin to assign\n     * @param selectedRolesToRemove Roles selected by admin to remove\n     * @return true if use case executed successfully, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(User targetUser, Set<Role> availableRoles,\n                                                   Set<Role> selectedRolesToAssign, Set<Role> selectedRolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Executing Use Case: Assign/RemoveRolesToAUser ===");\n        \n        // Step 1: Check preconditions\n        if (!checkPreconditions(targetUser)) {\n            System.err.println("Use case cannot proceed: Preconditions not met.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // System action 1: Display the role management form\n        displayRoleManagementForm(availableRoles, targetUser.getRoles());\n        \n        // User action null ? selectedRolesToAssign.size() : 0) + " role(s)");\n        System.out.println("Administrator selected roles to remove: " + \n                          (selectedRolesToRemove != null ? selectedRolesToRemove.size() : 0) + " role(s)");\n        \n        // User action 3: Click on the "Send" button\n        System.out.println("Administrator clicked on \'Send\' button.");\n        \n        \n        if (success) {\n            // Postcondition: The administrator interrupts the connection to the SMOS server\n            disconnectFromSmosServer();\n            System.out.println("Postcondition satisfied: SMOS server connection interrupted.");\n            \n            System.out.println("=== Use Case Completed Successfully ===\\n");\n        } else {\n            System.err.println("=== Use Case Failed ===\\n");\n        }\n        \n        return success;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * View user details (simulates the "viewdetTailsente" use case Console Simulation ***");\n        System.out.println("Managing roles for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("Administrator: " + administrator.getAdminName());\n        System.out.println("=================================================\\n");\n        \n        // Check if administrator can perform this action\n        if (!administrator.isLoggedIn()) {\n            System.err.println("Error: Administrator must be logged in to manage roles.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Display current user roles\n        displayCurrentUserRoles();\n        \n        // Display all available roles\n        displayAvailableRoles();\n        \n        // Get role selections from administrator\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Role Selection ---");\n        Set<Role> rolesToAssign = getRolesToAssign();\n        Set<Role> rolesToRemove = getRolesToRemove();\n        \n        // Confirm selections\n        if (!confirmSelections(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove)) {\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled by administrator.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Process the role changes\n        return processRoleChanges(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the current roles assigned to the target user.\n     */\n    private void displayCurrentUserRoles() {\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        System.out.println("Current roles assigned to " + targetUser.getUsername() + ":");\n        \n        if (userRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("  No roles currently assigned.");\n        } else {\n            int index = 1;\n            for (Role role : userRoles) {\n                System.out.println("  " + index + ". " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n                index++;\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display all available roles in the system.\n     */\n    private void displayAvailableRoles() {\n        System.out.println("Available roles in the system:");\n        \n        if (availableRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("  No roles available in the system.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        int index = 1;\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n            boolean isAssigned = userRoles.contains(role);\n            String status = isAssigned ? "[ASSIGNED]" : "[AVAILABLE]";\n            System.out.println("  " + index + ". " + role.getRoleName() + \n                             " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ") " + status);\n            index++;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get roles that the administrator wants to assign to the user.\n     * \n     * @return Set of roles to assign\n     */\n    private Set<Role> getRolesToAssign() {\n        Set<Role> rolesToAssign = new HashSet<>();\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nEnter roles to ASSIGN (by ID, separated by commas, or \'none\' for none):");\n        System.out.print("Selection: ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("none") || input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles selected for assignment.");\n            return rolesToAssign;\n        }\n        \n        String[] roleIds = input.split(",");\n        for (String roleId : roleIds) {\n            roleId = roleId.trim();\n            if (!roleId.isEmpty()) {\n                Role role = findRoleById(roleId);\n                if (role != null) {\n                    // Check if role is already assigned\n                    if (targetUser.hasRole(role)) {\n                        System.out.println("  Note: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + "\' is already assigned to the user.");\n                    } else {\n                        rolesToAssign.add(role);\n                        System.out.println("  Selected to assign: " + role.getRoleName());\n                    }\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("  Warning: Role with ID \'" + roleId + "\' not found.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return rolesToAssign;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get roles that the administrator wants to remove from the user.\n     * \n     * @return Set of roles to remove\n     */\n    private Set<Role> getRolesToRemove() {\n        Set<Role> rolesToRemove = new HashSet<>();\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        if (userRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("User has no roles to remove.");\n            return rolesToRemove;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nEnter roles to REMOVE (by ID, separated by commas, or \'none\' for none):");\n        System.out.print("Selection: ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("none") || input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles selected for removal.");\n            return rolesToRemove;\n        }\n        \n        String[] roleIds = input.split(",");\n        for (String roleId : roleIds) {\n            roleId = roleId.trim();\n            if (!roleId.isEmpty()) {\n                Role role = findRoleById(roleId);\n                if (role != null) {\n                    if (userRoles.contains(role)) {\n                        rolesToRemove.add(role);\n                        System.out.println("  Selected to remove: " + role.getRoleName());\n                    } else {\n                        System.out.println("  Note: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + "\' is not currently assigned to the user.");\n                    }\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("  Warning: Role with ID \'" + roleId + "\' not found.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return rolesToRemove;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Find a role by its ID in the available roles set.\n     * \n     * @param roleId The role ID to find\n     * @return The Role object if found, null otherwise\n     */\n    private Role findRoleById(String roleId) {\n        for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n            if (role.getRoleId().equals(roleId)) {\n                return role;\n            }\n        }\n        return null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Confirm the role selections with the administrator.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles selected for assignment\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles selected for removal\n     * @return true if administrator confirms, false if cancels\n     */\n    private boolean confirmSelections(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Confirm Changes ---");\n        System.out.println("Summary of changes for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        if (rolesToAssign.isEmpty() && rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No changes to make.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Roles to ASSIGN:");\n            for (Role role : rolesToAssign) {\n                System.out.println("  + " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (!rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Roles to REMOVE:");\n            for (Role role : rolesToRemove) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nConfirm these changes? (yes/no): ");\n        String response = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        return response.equalsIgnoreCase("yes") || response.equalsIgnoreCase("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Process the role changes based on administrator selections.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles to assign\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles to remove\n     * @return true if changes were successfully processed, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean processRoleChanges(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Processing Role Changes ---");\n        \n        // Remove conflicting roles (roles both assigned and removed)\n        Set<Role> conflicts = new HashSet<>(rolesToAssign);\n        conflicts.retainAll(rolesToRemove);\n        \n        if (!conflicts.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: The following roles are both assigned and removed:");\n            for (Role role : conflicts) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n            System.out.println("These roles will be processed as REMOVALS only.");\n            \n            // Remove conflicts from assignment list\n            rolesToAssign.removeAll(conflicts);\n        }\n        \n        // Process removals first\n        int removedCount = 0;\n        if (!rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            removedCount = targetUser.removeRoles(rolesToRemove);\n            System.out.println("Successfully removed " + removedCount + " role(s).");\n        }\n        \n        // Process assignments\n        int assignedCount = 0;\n        if (!rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            assignedCount = targetUser.assignRoles(rolesToAssign);\n            System.out.println("Successfully assigned " + assignedCount + " role(s).");\n        }\n        \n        // Display final result\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Final Result ---");\n        System.out.println("User: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("Total roles now assigned: " + targetUser.getRoleCount());\n        \n        Set<Role> finalRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        if (!finalRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Assigned roles:");\n            for (Role role : finalRoles) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Simulate the "Send" button action from the use case\n        System.out.println("\\n[SIMULATION] \'Send\' button clicked - changes applied successfully.");\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Close the form and release resources.\n     */\n    public void closeForm() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n        System.out.println("Role management form closed.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validate that the role selections are valid (no duplicates in assignment,\n     * roles to remove are actually assigned, etc.).\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles selected for assignment\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles selected for removal\n     * @return true if selections are valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean validateSelections(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        // Check for roles to remove that aren\'t actually assigned\n        for (Role role : rolesToRemove) {\n            if (!userRoles.contains(role)) {\n                System.err.println("Validation error: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + \n                                 "\' is not assigned to the user and cannot be removed.");\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Check for roles that would be both assigned and removed\n        Set<Role> intersection = new HashSet<>(rolesToAssign);\n        intersection.retainAll(rolesToRemove);\n        if (!intersection.isEmpty()) {\n            System.err.println("Validation error: The following roles are both assigned and removed:");\n            for (Role role : intersection) {\n                System.err.println("  - " + role.getRoleName());\n            }\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulate the form display without user interaction (for automated testing).\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Pre-determined roles to assign\n     * @param rolesToRemove Pre-determined roles to remove\n     * @return true if changes were successfully processed, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean simulateFormSubmission(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n*** Automated Form Submission ***");\n        System.out.println("Managing roles for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        if (!validateSelections(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove)) {\n            System.err.println("Form submission failed: Invalid role selections.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Process the changes\n        return administrator.processRoleChanges(targetUser, rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the target user of this form.\n     * \n     * @return The target user\n     */\n    public User getTargetUser() {\n        return targetUser;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the available roles for this form.\n     * \n     * @return Set of available roles\n     */\n    public Set<Role> getAvailableRoles() {\n        return new HashSet<>(availableRoles);\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the RoleManagementForm.java class. boolean processRoleChanges(User targetUser, Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        if (targetUser == null) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Target user is null.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if administrator is logged in and has permissions\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Administrator not logged in.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!smosServerConnected) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Not connected to SMOS server.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Processing role changes for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        // Remove roles first to avoid conflicts\n        int removedCount = 0;\n        if (rolesToRemove != null && !rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            removedCount = targetUser.removeRoles(rolesToRemove);\n            System.out.println("Removed " + removedCount + " role(s) from user.");\n        }\n        \n        // Assign new roles\n        int assignedCount = 0;\n        if (rolesToAssign != null && !rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            assignedCount = targetUser.assignRoles(rolesToAssign);\n            System.out.println("Assigned " + assignedCount + " role(s) to user.");\n        }\n        \n        // Display final state\n        System.out.println("User now has " + targetUser.getRoleCount() + " role(s) assigned.");\n        \n        // Postcondition: User roles are modified\n        System.out.println("Postcondition satisfied: User roles have been modified.");\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Execute the complete use case "Assign/RemoveRolesToAUser".\n     * This method simulates the entire workflow described in the use case.\n     * \n     * @param targetUser The user to assign/remove roles for\n     * @param availableRoles All available roles in the system\n     * @param selectedRolesToAssign Roles selected by admin to assign\n     * @param selectedRolesToRemove Roles selected by admin to remove\n     * @return true if use case executed successfully, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(User targetUser, Set<Role> availableRoles,\n                                                   Set<Role> selectedRolesToAssign, Set<Role> selectedRolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Executing Use Case: Assign/RemoveRolesToAUser ===");\n        \n        // Step 1: Check preconditions\n        if (!checkPreconditions(targetUser)) {\n            System.err.println("Use case cannot proceed: Preconditions not met.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // System action 1: Display the role management form\n        displayRoleManagementForm(availableRoles, targetUser.getRoles());\n        \n        // User action null ? selectedRolesToAssign.size() : 0) + " role(s)");\n        System.out.println("Administrator selected roles to remove: " + \n                          (selectedRolesToRemove != null ? selectedRolesToRemove.size() : 0) + " role(s)");\n        \n        // User action 3: Click on the "Send" button\n        System.out.println("Administrator clicked on \'Send\' button.");\n        \n        // System action 4: Assign or remove the user\'s roles as indicated by the administrator\n        boolean success = processRoleChanges(targetUser, selectedRolesToAssign, selectedRolesToRemove);\n        \n        if (success) {\n            // Postcondition: The administrator interrupts the connection to the SMOS server\n            disconnectFromSmosServer();\n            System.out.println("Postcondition satisfied: SMOS server connection interrupted.");\n            \n            System.out.println("=== Use Case Completed Successfully ===\\n");\n        } else {\n            System.err.println("=== Use Case Failed ===\\n");\n        }\n        \n        return success;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * View user details (simulates the "viewdetTailsente" use case System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println("=============================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n Console Simulation ***");\n        System.out.println("Managing roles for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("Administrator: " + administrator.getAdminName());\n        System.out.println("=================================================\\n");\n        \n        // Check if administrator can perform this action\n        if (!administrator.isLoggedIn()) {\n            System.err.println("Error: Administrator must be logged in to manage roles.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Display current user roles\n        displayCurrentUserRoles();\n        \n        // Display all available roles\n        displayAvailableRoles();\n        \n        // Get role selections from administrator\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Role Selection ---");\n        Set<Role> rolesToAssign = getRolesToAssign();\n        Set<Role> rolesToRemove = getRolesToRemove();\n        \n        // Confirm selections\n        if (!confirmSelections(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove)) {\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled by administrator.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Process the role changes\n        return processRoleChanges(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the current roles assigned to the target user.\n     */\n    private void displayCurrentUserRoles() {\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        System.out.println("Current roles assigned to " + targetUser.getUsername() + ":");\n        \n        if (userRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("  No roles currently assigned.");\n        } else {\n            int index = 1;\n            for (Role role : userRoles) {\n                System.out.println("  " + index + ". " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n                index++;\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display all available roles in the system.\n     */\n    private void displayAvailableRoles() {\n        System.out.println("Available roles in the system:");\n        \n        if (availableRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("  No roles available in the system.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        int index = 1;\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n            boolean isAssigned = userRoles.contains(role);\n            String status = isAssigned ? "[ASSIGNED]" : "[AVAILABLE]";\n            System.out.println("  " + index + ". " + role.getRoleName() + \n                             " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ") " + status);\n            index++;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get roles that the administrator wants to assign to the user.\n     * \n     * @return Set of roles to assign\n     */\n    private Set<Role> getRolesToAssign() {\n        Set<Role> rolesToAssign = new HashSet<>();\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nEnter roles to ASSIGN (by ID, separated by commas, or \'none\' for none):");\n        System.out.print("Selection: ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("none") || input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles selected for assignment.");\n            return rolesToAssign;\n        }\n        \n        String[] roleIds = input.split(",");\n        for (String roleId : roleIds) {\n            roleId = roleId.trim();\n            if (!roleId.isEmpty()) {\n                Role role = findRoleById(roleId);\n                if (role != null) {\n                    // Check if role is already assigned\n                    if (targetUser.hasRole(role)) {\n                        System.out.println("  Note: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + "\' is already assigned to the user.");\n                    } else {\n                        rolesToAssign.add(role);\n                        System.out.println("  Selected to assign: " + role.getRoleName());\n                    }\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("  Warning: Role with ID \'" + roleId + "\' not found.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return rolesToAssign;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get roles that the administrator wants to remove from the user.\n     * \n     * @return Set of roles to remove\n     */\n    private Set<Role> getRolesToRemove() {\n        Set<Role> rolesToRemove = new HashSet<>();\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        if (userRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("User has no roles to remove.");\n            return rolesToRemove;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nEnter roles to REMOVE (by ID, separated by commas, or \'none\' for none):");\n        System.out.print("Selection: ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("none") || input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles selected for removal.");\n            return rolesToRemove;\n        }\n        \n        String[] roleIds = input.split(",");\n        for (String roleId : roleIds) {\n            roleId = roleId.trim();\n            if (!roleId.isEmpty()) {\n                Role role = findRoleById(roleId);\n                if (role != null) {\n                    if (userRoles.contains(role)) {\n                        rolesToRemove.add(role);\n                        System.out.println("  Selected to remove: " + role.getRoleName());\n                    } else {\n                        System.out.println("  Note: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + "\' is not currently assigned to the user.");\n                    }\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("  Warning: Role with ID \'" + roleId + "\' not found.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return rolesToRemove;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Find a role by its ID in the available roles set.\n     * \n     * @param roleId The role ID to find\n     * @return The Role object if found, null otherwise\n     */\n    private Role findRoleById(String roleId) {\n        for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n            if (role.getRoleId().equals(roleId)) {\n                return role;\n            }\n        }\n        return null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Confirm the role selections with the administrator.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles selected for assignment\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles selected for removal\n     * @return true if administrator confirms, false if cancels\n     */\n    private boolean confirmSelections(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Confirm Changes ---");\n        System.out.println("Summary of changes for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        if (rolesToAssign.isEmpty() && rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No changes to make.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Roles to ASSIGN:");\n            for (Role role : rolesToAssign) {\n                System.out.println("  + " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (!rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Roles to REMOVE:");\n            for (Role role : rolesToRemove) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nConfirm these changes? (yes/no): ");\n        String response = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        return response.equalsIgnoreCase("yes") || response.equalsIgnoreCase("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Process the role changes based on administrator selections.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles to assign\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles to remove\n     * @return true if changes were successfully processed, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean processRoleChanges(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Processing Role Changes ---");\n        \n        // Remove conflicting roles (roles both assigned and removed)\n        Set<Role> conflicts = new HashSet<>(rolesToAssign);\n        conflicts.retainAll(rolesToRemove);\n        \n        if (!conflicts.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: The following roles are both assigned and removed:");\n            for (Role role : conflicts) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n            System.out.println("These roles will be processed as REMOVALS only.");\n            \n            // Remove conflicts from assignment list\n            rolesToAssign.removeAll(conflicts);\n        }\n        \n        // Process removals first\n        int removedCount = 0;\n        if (!rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            removedCount = targetUser.removeRoles(rolesToRemove);\n            System.out.println("Successfully removed " + removedCount + " role(s).");\n        }\n        \n        // Process assignments\n        int assignedCount = 0;\n        if (!rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            assignedCount = targetUser.assignRoles(rolesToAssign);\n            System.out.println("Successfully assigned " + assignedCount + " role(s).");\n        }\n        \n        // Display final result\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Final Result ---");\n        System.out.println("User: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("Total roles now assigned: " + targetUser.getRoleCount());\n        \n        Set<Role> finalRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        if (!finalRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Assigned roles:");\n            for (Role role : finalRoles) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Simulate the "Send" button action from the use case\n        System.out.println("\\n[SIMULATION] \'Send\' button clicked - changes applied successfully.");\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Close the form and release resources.\n     */\n    public void closeForm() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n        System.out.println("Role management form closed.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validate that the role selections are valid (no duplicates in assignment,\n     * roles to remove are actually assigned, etc.).\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles selected for assignment\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles selected for removal\n     * @return true if selections are valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean validateSelections(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        // Check for roles to remove that aren\'t actually assigned\n        for (Role role : rolesToRemove) {\n            if (!userRoles.contains(role)) {\n                System.err.println("Validation error: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + \n                                 "\' is not assigned to the user and cannot be removed.");\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Check for roles that would be both assigned and removed\n        Set<Role> intersection = new HashSet<>(rolesToAssign);\n        intersection.retainAll(rolesToRemove);\n        if (!intersection.isEmpty()) {\n            System.err.println("Validation error: The following roles are both assigned and removed:");\n            for (Role role : intersection) {\n                System.err.println("  - " + role.getRoleName());\n            }\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulate the form display without user interaction (for automated testing).\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Pre-determined roles to assign\n     * @param rolesToRemove Pre-determined roles to remove\n     * @return true if changes were successfully processed, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean simulateFormSubmission(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n*** Automated Form Submission ***");\n        System.out.println("Managing roles for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        if (!validateSelections(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove)) {\n            System.err.println("Form submission failed: Invalid role selections.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Process the changes\n        return administrator.processRoleChanges(targetUser, rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the target user of this form.\n     * \n     * @return The target user\n     */\n    public User getTargetUser() {\n        return targetUser;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the available roles for this form.\n     * \n     * @return Set of available roles\n     */\n    public Set<Role> getAvailableRoles() {\n        return new HashSet<>(availableRoles);\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the RoleManagementForm.java class.
