import java.util.HashSet;
import java.util.Set;

/**
 * Main class demonstrating the complete 'Assign/RemoveRolesToAUser' use case.
 * This program creates sample users, roles, and administrators, then demonstrates
 * the complete workflow as described in the use case requirements.
 */
public class AssignRemoveRolesMain {
    
    /**
     * Main method - entry point of the program.
     * Demonstrates the complete use case with multiple scenarios.
     * 
     * @param args Command line arguments (not used)
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("=== Assign/RemoveRolesToAUser Use Case Demonstration ===\n");
        
        // Scenario 1: Complete use case with console interaction
        System.out.println("SCENARIO 1: Complete Use Case with Console Interaction");
        System.out.println("========================================================");
        demonstrateCompleteUseCase();
        
        // Scenario 2: Automated use case execution
        System.out.println("\n\nSCENARIO 2: Automated Use Case Execution");
        System.out.println("==========================================");
        demonstrateAutomatedUseCase();
        
        // Scenario 3: Edge case handling
        System.out.println("\n\nSCENARIO 3: Edge Case Handling");
        System.out.println("===============================");
        demonstrateEdgeCases();
        
        System.out.println("\n=== Use Case Demonstration Complete ===");
    }
    
    /**
     * Demonstrates the complete use case with console interaction simulation.
     * Follows the exact sequence described in the use case documentation.
     */
    private static void demonstrateCompleteUseCase() {
        System.out.println("\nStep 1: Setting up the system environment...");
        
        // Create sample roles
        Set<Role> availableRoles = createSampleRoles();
        System.out.println("Created " + availableRoles.size() + " sample roles.");
        
        // Create a target user
        User targetUser = new User("U001", "john_doe");
        System.out.println("Created target user: " + targetUser.getUsername());
        
        // Assign some initial roles to the user
        Role userRole = getRoleById(availableRoles, "ROLE_USER");
        Role viewerRole = getRoleById(availableRoles, "ROLE_VIEWER");
        if (userRole != null) targetUser.assignRole(userRole);
        if (viewerRole != null) targetUser.assignRole(viewerRole);
        System.out.println("Assigned initial roles to user.");
        
        // Create an administrator
        Administrator admin = new Administrator("ADMIN001", "Alice Smith");
        System.out.println("Created administrator: " + admin.getAdminName());
        
        System.out.println("\nStep 2: Simulating use case preconditions...");
        
        // Precondition: Administrator logs in
        admin.login();
        
        // Precondition: Connect to SMOS server
        admin.connectToSmosServer();
        
        // Precondition: Administrator views user details (simulating "viewdetTailsente" use case)
        admin.viewUserDetails(targetUser);
        
        // Simulate: User clicks on "User Roles" button
        System.out.println("[SIMULATION] User clicked on 'User Roles' button.");
        
        System.out.println("\nStep 3: Displaying role management form...");
        
        // Create role management form
        RoleManagementForm form = new RoleManagementForm(admin, targetUser, availableRoles);
        
        // Display and process the form (console interaction simulation)
        boolean formProcessed = form.displayAndProcessForm();
        
        // Postcondition: Administrator interrupts SMOS server connection
        admin.disconnectFromSmosServer();
        
        if (formProcessed) {
            System.out.println("Use case completed successfully!");
        } else {
            System.out.println("Use case completed with issues.");
        }
        
        // Close form resources
        form.closeForm();
        
        // Logout administrator
        admin.logout();
    }
    
    /**
     * Demonstrates automated execution of the use case without user interaction.
     * Uses pre-defined role selections to show the automated workflow.
     */
    private static void demonstrateAutomatedUseCase() {
        System.out.println("\nStep 1: Setting up automated test environment...");
        
        // Create sample roles
        Set<Role> availableRoles = createSampleRoles();
        
        // Create a target user
        User targetUser = new User("U002", "jane_smith");
        
        // Assign initial roles
        Role userRole = getRoleById(availableRoles, "ROLE_USER");
        Role editorRole = getRoleById(availableRoles, "ROLE_EDITOR");
        if (userRole != null) targetUser.assignRole(userRole);
        if (editorRole != null) targetUser.assignRole(editorRole);
        
        System.out.println("Created user '" + targetUser.getUsername() + "' with " + 
                          targetUser.getRoleCount() + " initial roles.");
        
        // Create administrator
        Administrator admin = new Administrator("ADMIN002", "Bob Johnson");
        
        // Login and connect to server
        admin.login();
        admin.connectToSmosServer();
        
        // View user details (precondition)
        admin.viewUserDetails(targetUser);
        
        System.out.println("\nStep 2: Automated role selection...");
        
        // Predefine roles to assign and remove
        Set<Role> rolesToAssign = new HashSet<>();
        Set<Role> rolesToRemove = new HashSet<>();
        
        // Select roles to assign
        Role adminRole = getRoleById(availableRoles, "ROLE_ADMIN");
        Role auditorRole = getRoleById(availableRoles, "ROLE_AUDITOR");
        if (adminRole != null) rolesToAssign.add(adminRole);
        if (auditorRole != null) rolesToAssign.add(auditorRole);
        
        // Select roles to remove
        if (editorRole != null) rolesToRemove.add(editorRole);
        
        System.out.println("Automated selection:");
        System.out.println("  Roles to assign: " + rolesToAssign.size());
        System.out.println("  Roles to remove: " + rolesToRemove.size());
        
        System.out.println("\nStep 3: Executing use case with executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase()...");
        
        // Execute the complete use case using the administrator's method
        boolean success = admin.executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(
            targetUser, availableRoles, rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove);
        
        System.out.println("\nStep 4: Verifying results...");
        System.out.println("User '" + targetUser.getUsername() + "' now has " + 
                          targetUser.getRoleCount() + " roles.");
        
        // Display final user state
        admin.viewUserDetails(targetUser);
        
        // Cleanup
        admin.disconnectFromSmosServer();
        admin.logout();
        
        if (success) {
            System.out.println("Automated use case execution: SUCCESS");
        } else {
            System.out.println("Automated use case execution: FAILED");
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Demonstrates handling of edge cases and error conditions.
     * Shows how the system handles invalid inputs and boundary conditions.
     */
    private static void demonstrateEdgeCases() {
        System.out.println("\nTesting edge cases and error handling...");
        
        // Edge Case 1: Null user
        System.out.println("\nEdge Case 1: Handling null user");
        System.out.println("---------------------------------");
        Administrator admin = new Administrator("ADMIN003", "Charlie Brown");
        admin.login();
        admin.connectToSmosServer();
        
        // Try to execute use case with null user
        Set<Role> roles = createSampleRoles();
        boolean result = admin.executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(null, roles, new HashSet<>(), new HashSet<>());
        System.out.println("Result with null user: " + (result ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED (expected)"));
        
        // Edge Case 2: Empty role sets
        System.out.println("\nEdge Case 2: Empty role selections");
        System.out.println("-----------------------------------");
        User testUser = new User("U003", "test_user");
        admin.viewUserDetails(testUser);
        
        // Execute with empty selections
        result = admin.executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(testUser, roles, new HashSet<>(), new HashSet<>());
        System.out.println("Result with empty selections: " + (result ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED"));
        
        // Edge Case 3: Administrator not logged in
        System.out.println("\nEdge Case 3: Administrator not logged in");
        System.out.println("-----------------------------------------");
        admin.logout(); // Logout first
        
        Administrator notLoggedInAdmin = new Administrator("ADMIN004", "NotLogged");
        // Don't call login() for this administrator
        
        result = notLoggedInAdmin.executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(testUser, roles, new HashSet<>(), new HashSet<>());
        System.out.println("Result when admin not logged in: " + (result ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED (expected)"));
        
        // Edge Case 4: Duplicate role assignment
        System.out.println("\nEdge Case 4: Duplicate role assignment");
        System.out.println("---------------------------------------");
        User dupUser = new User("U004", "dup_user");
        Role userRole = getRoleById(roles, "ROLE_USER");
        
        if (userRole != null) {
            // Assign role once
            boolean firstAssign = dupUser.assignRole(userRole);
            System.out.println("First assignment of ROLE_USER: " + (firstAssign ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED"));
            
            // Try to assign the same role again
            boolean secondAssign = dupUser.assignRole(userRole);
            System.out.println("Second assignment of ROLE_USER: " + (secondAssign ? "SUCCESS (unexpected)" : "FAILED (expected - duplicate)"));
            
            System.out.println("User has " + dupUser.getRoleCount() + " roles (should be 1).");
        }
        
        // Edge Case 5: Remove non-existent role
        System.out.println("\nEdge Case 5: Removing non-existent role");
        System.out.println("----------------------------------------");
        User emptyUser = new User("U005", "empty_user");
        Role nonExistentRole = new Role("NON_EXISTENT", "Non Existent Role");
        
        boolean removeResult = emptyUser.removeRole(nonExistentRole);
        System.out.println("Removing non-existent role: " + (removeResult ? "SUCCESS (unexpected)" : "FAILED (expected)"));
        
        // Edge Case 6: Null role handling
        System.out.println("\nEdge Case 6: Null role handling");
        System.out.println("-------------------------------");
        User nullTestUser = new User("U006", "null_test");
        
        // Try to assign null role
        boolean nullAssign = nullTestUser.assignRole(null);
        System.out.println("Assigning null role: " + (nullAssign ? "SUCCESS (unexpected)" : "FAILED (expected)"));
        
        // Try to remove null role
        boolean nullRemove = nullTestUser.removeRole(null);
        System.out.println("Removing null role: " + (nullRemove ? "SUCCESS (unexpected)" : "FAILED (expected)"));
        
        // Cleanup
        admin.disconnectFromSmosServer();
        
        System.out.println("\nAll edge cases tested successfully!");
    }
    
    /**
     * Creates a set of sample roles for demonstration purposes.
     * 
     * @return Set of sample Role objects
     */
    private static Set<Role> createSampleRoles() {
        Set<Role> roles = new HashSet<>();
        
        // Create standard system roles
        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_ADMIN", "Administrator"));
        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_USER", "Standard User"));
        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_EDITOR", "Content Editor"));
        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_VIEWER", "Content Viewer"));
        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_AUDITOR", "Auditor"));
        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_REPORTER", "Report Generator"));
        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_MODERATOR", "Content Moderator"));
        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_ANALYST", "Data Analyst"));
        
        return roles;
    }
    
    /**
     * Helper method to find a role by ID in a set of roles.
     * 
     * @param roles Set of roles to search
     * @param roleId ID of the role to find
     * @return Role object if found, null otherwise
     */
    private static Role getRoleById(Set<Role> roles, String roleId) {
        if (roles == null || roleId == null) {
            return null;
        }
        
        for (Role role : roles) {
            if (role.getRoleId().equals(roleId)) {
                return role;
            }
        }
        
        return null;
    }
    
    /**
     * Displays a summary of the use case requirements.
     * This method provides documentation of the use case being implemented.
     */
    private static void displayUseCaseSummary() {
        System.out.println("\n=== Use Case Summary: Assign/RemoveRolesToAUser ===");
        System.out.println("Actors: Administrator");
        System.out.println("Description: Allows you to assign or remove roles to a user");
        System.out.println("\nPreconditions:");
        System.out.println("1. The user is logged in as an administrator");
        System.out.println("2. The user has carried out the case of use 'viewdetTailsente'");
        System.out.println("3. The system is viewing the details of a user");
        System.out.println("4. The user click on the 'User Roles' button");
        
        System.out.println("\nEvents Sequence:");
        System.out.println("User Actions:");
        System.out.println("2. Select the roles to be assigned or removed to the user");
        System.out.println("3. Click on the 'Send' button");
        
        System.out.println("\nSystem Actions:");
        System.out.println("1. Displays the role management form");
        System.out.println("4. Assign or remove the user's roles as indicated by the administrator");
        
        System.out.println("\nPostconditions:");
        System.out.println("1. User roles are modified");
        System.out.println("2. The administrator interrupts the connection to the SMOS server");
        System.out.println("====================================================\n");
    }
    
    /**
     * Demonstrates the role management functionality with a simple example.
     * This is a utility method that can be used for quick testing.
     */
    public static void demonstrateRoleManagement() {
        System.out.println("\n=== Quick Role Management Demonstration ===");
        
        // Create a user
        User user = new User("TEST001", "Test User");
        
        // Create some roles
        Role role1 = new Role("R001", "Manager");
        Role role2 = new Role("R002", "Developer");
        Role role3 = new Role("R003", "Tester");
        
        // Assign roles
        user.assignRole(role1);
        user.assignRole(role2);
        
        System.out.println("After assigning 2 roles:");
        System.out.println("User: " + user.getUsername());
        System.out.println("Roles count: " + user.getRoleCount());
        
        // Check if user has a specific role
        System.out.println("Has 'Manager' role: " + user.hasRole(role1));
        System.out.println("Has 'Tester' role: " + user.hasRole(role3));
        
        // Remove a role
        user.removeRole(role1);
        System.out.println("\nAfter removing 'Manager' role:");
        System.out.println("Roles count: " + user.getRoleCount());
        System.out.println("Has 'Manager' role: " + user.hasRole(role1));
        
        // Assign multiple roles at once
        Set<Role> newRoles = new HashSet<>();
        newRoles.add(role1);
        newRoles.add(role3);
        
        int added = user.assignRoles(newRoles);
        System.out.println("\nAfter assigning " + added + " new roles:");
        System.out.println("Total roles: " + user.getRoleCount());
        
        System.out.println("\nFinal user state:");
        System.out.println(user);
    }

Console Simulation ***");\n        System.out.println("Managing roles for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("Administrator: " + administrator.getAdminName());\n        System.out.println("=================================================\\n");\n        \n        // Check if administrator can perform this action\n        if (!administrator.isLoggedIn()) {\n            System.err.println("Error: Administrator must be logged in to manage roles.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Display current user roles\n        displayCurrentUserRoles();\n        \n        // Display all available roles\n        displayAvailableRoles();\n        \n        // Get role selections from administrator\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Role Selection ---");\n        Set<Role> rolesToAssign = getRolesToAssign();\n        Set<Role> rolesToRemove = getRolesToRemove();\n        \n        // Confirm selections\n        if (!confirmSelections(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove)) {\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled by administrator.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Process the role changes\n        return processRoleChanges(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the current roles assigned to the target user.\n     */\n    private void displayCurrentUserRoles() {\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        System.out.println("Current roles assigned to " + targetUser.getUsername() + ":");\n        \n        if (userRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("  No roles currently assigned.");\n        } else {\n            int index = 1;\n            for (Role role : userRoles) {\n                System.out.println("  " + index + ". " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n                index++;\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display all available roles in the system.\n     */\n    private void displayAvailableRoles() {\n        System.out.println("Available roles in the system:");\n        \n        if (availableRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("  No roles available in the system.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        int index = 1;\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n            boolean isAssigned = userRoles.contains(role);\n            String status = isAssigned ? "[ASSIGNED]" : "[AVAILABLE]";\n            System.out.println("  " + index + ". " + role.getRoleName() + \n                             " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ") " + status);\n            index++;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get roles that the administrator wants to assign to the user.\n     * \n     * @return Set of roles to assign\n     */\n    private Set<Role> getRolesToAssign() {\n        Set<Role> rolesToAssign = new HashSet<>();\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nEnter roles to ASSIGN (by ID, separated by commas, or \'none\' for none):");\n        System.out.print("Selection: ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("none") || input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles selected for assignment.");\n            return rolesToAssign;\n        }\n        \n        String[] roleIds = input.split(",");\n        for (String roleId : roleIds) {\n            roleId = roleId.trim();\n            if (!roleId.isEmpty()) {\n                Role role = findRoleById(roleId);\n                if (role != null) {\n                    // Check if role is already assigned\n                    if (targetUser.hasRole(role)) {\n                        System.out.println("  Note: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + "\' is already assigned to the user.");\n                    } else {\n                        rolesToAssign.add(role);\n                        System.out.println("  Selected to assign: " + role.getRoleName());\n                    }\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("  Warning: Role with ID \'" + roleId + "\' not found.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return rolesToAssign;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get roles that the administrator wants to remove from the user.\n     * \n     * @return Set of roles to remove\n     */\n    private Set<Role> getRolesToRemove() {\n        Set<Role> rolesToRemove = new HashSet<>();\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        if (userRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("User has no roles to remove.");\n            return rolesToRemove;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nEnter roles to REMOVE (by ID, separated by commas, or \'none\' for none):");\n        System.out.print("Selection: ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("none") || input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles selected for removal.");\n            return rolesToRemove;\n        }\n        \n        String[] roleIds = input.split(",");\n        for (String roleId : roleIds) {\n            roleId = roleId.trim();\n            if (!roleId.isEmpty()) {\n                Role role = findRoleById(roleId);\n                if (role != null) {\n                    if (userRoles.contains(role)) {\n                        rolesToRemove.add(role);\n                        System.out.println("  Selected to remove: " + role.getRoleName());\n                    } else {\n                        System.out.println("  Note: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + "\' is not currently assigned to the user.");\n                    }\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("  Warning: Role with ID \'" + roleId + "\' not found.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return rolesToRemove;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Find a role by its ID in the available roles set.\n     * \n     * @param roleId The role ID to find\n     * @return The Role object if found, null otherwise\n     */\n    private Role findRoleById(String roleId) {\n        for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n            if (role.getRoleId().equals(roleId)) {\n                return role;\n            }\n        }\n        return null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Confirm the role selections with the administrator.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles selected for assignment\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles selected for removal\n     * @return true if administrator confirms, false if cancels\n     */\n    private boolean confirmSelections(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Confirm Changes ---");\n        System.out.println("Summary of changes for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        if (rolesToAssign.isEmpty() && rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No changes to make.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Roles to ASSIGN:");\n            for (Role role : rolesToAssign) {\n                System.out.println("  + " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (!rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Roles to REMOVE:");\n            for (Role role : rolesToRemove) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nConfirm these changes? (yes/no): ");\n        String response = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        return response.equalsIgnoreCase("yes") || response.equalsIgnoreCase("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Process the role changes based on administrator selections.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles to assign\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles to remove\n     * @return true if changes were successfully processed, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean processRoleChanges(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Processing Role Changes ---");\n        \n        // Remove conflicting roles (roles both assigned and removed)\n        Set<Role> conflicts = new HashSet<>(rolesToAssign);\n        conflicts.retainAll(rolesToRemove);\n        \n        if (!conflicts.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: The following roles are both assigned and removed:");\n            for (Role role : conflicts) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n            System.out.println("These roles will be processed as REMOVALS only.");\n            \n            // Remove conflicts from assignment list\n            rolesToAssign.removeAll(conflicts);\n        }\n        \n        // Process removals first\n        int removedCount = 0;\n        if (!rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            removedCount = targetUser.removeRoles(rolesToRemove);\n            System.out.println("Successfully removed " + removedCount + " role(s).");\n        }\n        \n        // Process assignments\n        int assignedCount = 0;\n        if (!rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            assignedCount = targetUser.assignRoles(rolesToAssign);\n            System.out.println("Successfully assigned " + assignedCount + " role(s).");\n        }\n        \n        // Display final result\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Final Result ---");\n        System.out.println("User: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("Total roles now assigned: " + targetUser.getRoleCount());\n        \n        Set<Role> finalRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        if (!finalRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Assigned roles:");\n            for (Role role : finalRoles) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Simulate the "Send" button action from the use case\n        System.out.println("\\n[SIMULATION] \'Send\' button clicked - changes applied successfully.");\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Close the form and release resources.\n     */\n    public void closeForm() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n        System.out.println("Role management form closed.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validate that the role selections are valid (no duplicates in assignment,\n     * roles to remove are actually assigned, etc.).\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles selected for assignment\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles selected for removal\n     * @return true if selections are valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean validateSelections(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        // Check for roles to remove that aren\'t actually assigned\n        for (Role role : rolesToRemove) {\n            if (!userRoles.contains(role)) {\n                System.err.println("Validation error: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + \n                                 "\' is not assigned to the user and cannot be removed.");\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Check for roles that would be both assigned and removed\n        Set<Role> intersection = new HashSet<>(rolesToAssign);\n        intersection.retainAll(rolesToRemove);\n        if (!intersection.isEmpty()) {\n            System.err.println("Validation error: The following roles are both assigned and removed:");\n            for (Role role : intersection) {\n                System.err.println("  - " + role.getRoleName());\n            }\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulate the form display without user interaction (for automated testing).\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Pre-determined roles to assign\n     * @param rolesToRemove Pre-determined roles to remove\n     * @return true if changes were successfully processed, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean simulateFormSubmission(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n*** Automated Form Submission ***");\n        System.out.println("Managing roles for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        if (!validateSelections(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove)) {\n            System.err.println("Form submission failed: Invalid role selections.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Process the changes\n        return administrator.processRoleChanges(targetUser, rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the target user of this form.\n     * \n     * @return The target user\n     */\n    public User getTargetUser() {\n        return targetUser;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the available roles for this form.\n     * \n     * @return Set of available roles\n     */\n    public Set<Role> getAvailableRoles() {\n        return new HashSet<>(availableRoles);\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the RoleManagementForm.java class. show the automated workflow.\n     */\n    private static void demonstrateAutomatedUseCase() {\n        System.out.println("\\nStep 1: Setting up automated test environment...");\n        \n        // Create sample roles\n        Set<Role> availableRoles = createSampleRoles();\n        \n        // Create a target user\n        User targetUser = new User("U002", "jane_smith");\n        \n        // Assign initial roles\n        Role userRole = getRoleById(availableRoles, "ROLE_USER");\n        Role editorRole = getRoleById(availableRoles, "ROLE_EDITOR");\n        if (userRole != null) targetUser.assignRole(userRole);\n        if (editorRole != null) targetUser.assignRole(editorRole);\n        \n        System.out.println("Created user \'" + targetUser.getUsername() + "\' with " +     \n        // Login and connect to server\n        admin.login();\n        admin.connectToSmosServer();\n        \n        // View user details (precondition)\n        admin.viewUserDetails(targetUser);\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nStep 2: Automated role selection...");\n        \n        // Predefine roles to assign and remove\n        Set<Role> rolesToAssign = new HashSet<>();\n        Set<Role> rolesToRemove = new HashSet<>();\n        \n        // Select roles to assign\n        Role adminRole = getRoleById(availableRoles, "ROLE_ADMIN");\n        Role auditorRole = getRoleById(availableRoles, "ROLE_AUDITOR");\n        if (adminRole != null) rolesToAssign.add(adminRole);\n        if (auditorRole != null) rolesToAssign.add(auditorRole);\n        \n        // Select roles to remove\n        if (editorRole != null) rolesToRemove.add(editorRole);\n        \n        System.out.println("Automated selection:");\n        System.out.println("  Roles to assign: " + rolesToAssign.size());\n        System.out.println("  Roles to remove: " + rolesToRemove.size());\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nStep 3: Executing use case with executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase()...");\n        \n        // Execute the complete use case using the administrator\'s method\n        boolean success = admin.executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(\n            targetUser, availableRoles, rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove);\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nStep 4: Verifying results...");\n        System.out.println("User \'" + admin.viewUserDetails(targetUser);\n        \n        // Cleanup\n        admin.disconnectFromSmosServer();\n        admin.logout();\n        \n        if (success) {\n            System.out.println("Automated use case execution: SUCCESS");\n        } else {\n            System.out.println("Automated use case execution: FAILED");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Demonstrates handling of edge cases and error conditions.\n     * Shows how the system handles invalid inputs and boundary conditions.\n     */\n    private static void demonstrateEdgeCases() {\n        System.out.println("\\nTesting edge cases and error handling...");\n        \n        // Edge Case 1: Null user\n        System.out.println("\\nEdge Case 1: Handling null user");\n        System.out.println("---------------------------------");\n        Administrator admin = new Administrator("ADMIN003", "Charlie Brown");\n        admin.login();\n        admin.connectToSmosServer();\n        \n        // Try to execute use case with null user\n        Set<Role> roles = createSampleRoles();\n        boolean result = admin.executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(null, roles, new HashSet<>(), new HashSet<>());\n        System.out.println("Result with null user: " + (result ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED (expected)"));\n        \n        // Edge Case 2: Empty role sets\n        System.out.println("\\nEdge Case 2: Empty role selections");\n        System.out.println("-----------------------------------");\n        User testUser = new User("U003", "test_user");\n        admin.viewUserDetails(testUser);\n        \n        // Execute with empty selections\n        result = admin.executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(testUser, roles, new HashSet<>(), new HashSet<>());\n        System.out.println("Result with empty selections: " + (result ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED"));\n        \n        // Edge Case 3: Administrator not logged in\n        System.out.println("\\nEdge Case 3: Administrator not logged in");\n        System.out.println("-----------------------------------------");\n        admin.logout(); // Logout first\n        \n        Administrator notLoggedInAdmin = new Administrator("ADMIN004", "NotLogged");\n        // Don\'t call login() for this administrator\n        \n        result = notLoggedInAdmin.executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(testUser, roles, new HashSet<>(), new HashSet<>());\n        System.out.println("Result when admin not logged in: " + (result ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED (expected)"));\n        \n        // Edge Case 4: Duplicate role assignment\n        System.out.println("\\nEdge Case 4: Duplicate role assignment");\n        System.out.println("---------------------------------------");\n        User dupUser = new User("U004", "dup_user");\n        Role userRole = getRoleById(roles, "ROLE_USER");\n        \n        if (userRole != null) {\n            // Assign role once\n            boolean firstAssign = dupUser.assignRole(userRole);\n            System.out.println("First assignment of ROLE_USER: " + (firstAssign ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED"));\n            \n            // Try to assign the same role again\n            boolean secondAssign = dupUser.assignRole(userRole);\n            System.out.println("Second assignment of ROLE_USER: " + (secondAssign ? "SUCCESS (unexpected)" : "FAILED (expected - duplicate)"));\n            \n            System.out.println("User has " + dupUser.getRoleCount() + " roles (should be 1).");\n        }\n        \n        // Edge Case 5: Remove non-existent role\n        System.out.println("\\nEdge Case 5: Removing non-existent role");\n        System.out.println("----------------------------------------");\n        User emptyUser = new User("U005", "empty_user");\n        Role nonExistentRole = new Role("NON_EXISTENT", "Non Existent Role");\n        \n        boolean removeResult = emptyUser.removeRole(nonExistentRole);\n        System.out.println("Removing non-existent role: " + (removeResult ? "SUCCESS (unexpected)" : "FAILED (expected)"));\n        \n        // Edge Case 6: Null role handling\n        System.out.println("\\nEdge Case 6: Null role handling");\n        System.out.println("-------------------------------");\n        User nullTestUser = new User("U006", "null_test");\n        \n        // Try to assign null role\n        boolean nullAssign = nullTestUser.assignRole(null);\n        System.out.println("Assigning null role: " + (nullAssign ? "SUCCESS (unexpected)" : "FAILED (expected)"));\n        \n        // Try to remove null role\n        boolean nullRemove = nullTestUser.removeRole(null);\n        System.out.println("Removing null role: " + (nullRemove ? "SUCCESS (unexpected)" : "FAILED (expected)"));\n        \n        // Cleanup\n        admin.disconnectFromSmosServer();\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nAll edge cases tested successfully!");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a set of sample roles for demonstration purposes.\n     * \n     * @return Set of sample Role objects\n     */\n    private static Set<Role> createSampleRoles() {\n        Set<Role> roles = new HashSet<>();\n        \n        // Create standard system roles\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_ADMIN", "Administrator"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_USER", "Standard User"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_EDITOR", "Content Editor"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_VIEWER", "Content Viewer"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_AUDITOR", "Auditor"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_REPORTER", "Report Generator"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_MODERATOR", "Content Moderator"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_ANALYST", "Data Analyst"));\n        \n        return roles;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Helper method to find a role by ID in a set of roles.\n     * \n     * @param roles Set of roles to search\n     * @param roleId ID of the role to find\n     * @return Role object if found, null otherwise\n     */\n    private static Role getRoleById(Set<Role> roles, String roleId) {\n        if (roles == null || roleId == null) {\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        for (Role role : roles) {\n            if (role.getRoleId().equals(roleId)) {\n                return role;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays a summary of the use case requirements.\n     * This method provides documentation of the use case being implemented.\n     */\n    private static void displayUseCaseSummary() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Use Case Summary: Assign/RemoveRolesToAUser ===");\n        System.out.println("Actors: Administrator");\n        System.out.println("Description: Allows you to assign or remove roles to a user");\n        System.out.println("\\nPreconditions:");\n The system is viewing the details of a user");\n        System.out.println("4. Click on the \'Send\' button");\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nSystem Actions:");\n        System.out.println("1. Displays the role management form");\n        System.out.println("4. Assign or remove the user\'s roles as indicated by the administrator");\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nPostconditions:");\n        System.out.println("1. User roles are modified");\n        System.out.println("2. The administrator interrupts the connection to the SMOS server");\n        System.out.println("====================================================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Demonstrates the role management functionality with a simple example.\n     * This is a utility method that can be used for quick testing.\n     */\n    public static void demonstrateRoleManagement() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Quick Role Management Demonstration ===");\n        \n        // Create a user\n        User user = new User("TEST001", "Test User");\n        \n        // Create some roles\n        Role role1 = new Role("R001", "Manager");\n        Role role2 = new Role("R002", "Developer");\n        Role role3 = new Role("R003", "Tester");\n        \n        // Assign roles\n        user.assignRole(role1);\n        user.assignRole(role2);\n        \n        System.out.println("After assigning 2 roles:");\n        System.out.println("User: " + user.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("Roles count: " + user.getRoleCount());\n        \n        // Check if user has a specific role\n        System.out.println("Has \'Manager\' role: " + user.hasRole(role1));\n        System.out.println("Has \'Tester\' role: " + user.hasRole(role3));\n        \n        // Remove a role\n        user.removeRole(role1);\n        System.out.println("\\nAfter removing \'Manager\' role:");\n        System.out.println("Roles count: " + user.getRoleCount());\n        System.out.println("Has \'Manager\' role: " + user.hasRole(role1));\n        \n        // Assign multiple roles at once\n        Set<Role> newRoles = new HashSet<>();\n        newRoles.add(role1);\n        newRoles.add(role3);\n        \n        int added = user.assignRoles(newRoles);\n        System.out.println("\\nAfter assigning " + added + " new roles:");\n        System.out.println("Total roles: " + user.getRoleCount());\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nFinal user state:");\n private Set<Role> roles;\n    \n    /**\n     * Default constructor.\n     */\n    public User() {\n        this.userId = "";\n        this.username = "";\n        this.roles = new HashSet<>();\n userId, String username) {\n        this.userId = userId;\n        this.username = username;\n        this.roles = new HashSet<>();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor with parameters including initial roles.\n     * \n     * @param userId Unique identifier for the user\n     * @param username Username of the user\n     * @param roles Initial set of roles for the user\n     */\n    public no action is taken.\n     * \n     * @param role Role to assign\n     * @return true if role was added (not already present), false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean assignRole(Role role) {\n        if (role == null) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot assign null role to user: " + username);\n            return false;\n        }\n        return roles.add(role);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Remove a role from the user.\n     * If the role is not assigned, no action is taken.\n     * \n     * @param role Role to remove\n     * @return true if role was removed (was present), false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean removeRole(Role role) {\n        if (role == null) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot remove null role from user: " + username);\n            return false;\n        }\n        return roles.remove(role);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if the user has a specific role.\n     * \n     * @param role Role to check\n     * @return true if user has the role, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean hasRole(Role role) {\n        if (role == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        return roles.contains(role);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if the user has a role with the given ID.\n     * \n     * @param roleId Role ID to check\n     * @return true if user has a role with the given ID, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean hasRoleById(String roleId) {\n        if (roleId == null || roleId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        for (Role role : roles) {\n            if (roleId.equals(role.getRoleId())) {\n                return true;\n            }\n        }\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the number of roles assigned to the user.\n     * \n     * @return Number of roles\n     */\n    public int getRoleCount() {\n        return roles.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clear all roles from the user.\n     */\n    public void clearAllRoles() {\n        roles.clear();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Assign multiple roles to the user.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Set of roles to assign\n     * @return Number of roles successfully added (excluding duplicates)\n     */\n    public int assignRoles(Set<Role> rolesToAssign) {\n        if (rolesToAssign == null || rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            return 0;\n        }\n        \n        int addedCount = 0;\n        for (Role role : rolesToAssign) {\n            if (role != null && roles.add(role)) {\n                addedCount++;\n            }\n        }\n        return addedCount;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Remove multiple roles from the user.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToRemove Set of roles to remove\n     * @return Number of roles successfully removed\n     */\n    public int removeRoles(Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        if (rolesToRemove == null || rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            return 0;\n        }\n        \n        int removedCount = 0;\n        for (Role role : rolesToRemove) {\n            if (role != null && roles.remove(role)) {\n                removedCount++;\n            }\n        }\n        return Console Simulation ***");\n        System.out.println("Managing roles for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("Administrator: " + administrator.getAdminName());\n        System.out.println("=================================================\\n");\n        \n        // Check if administrator can perform this action\n        if (!administrator.isLoggedIn()) {\n            System.err.println("Error: Administrator must be logged in to manage roles.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Display current user roles\n        displayCurrentUserRoles();\n        \n        // Display all available roles\n        displayAvailableRoles();\n        \n        // Get role selections from administrator\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Role Selection ---");\n        Set<Role> rolesToAssign = getRolesToAssign();\n        Set<Role> rolesToRemove = getRolesToRemove();\n        \n        // Confirm selections\n        if (!confirmSelections(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove)) {\n            System.out.println("Operation cancelled by administrator.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Process the role changes\n        return processRoleChanges(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the current roles assigned to the target user.\n     */\n    private void displayCurrentUserRoles() {\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        System.out.println("Current roles assigned to " + targetUser.getUsername() + ":");\n        \n        if (userRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("  No roles currently assigned.");\n        } else {\n            int index = 1;\n            for (Role role : userRoles) {\n                System.out.println("  " + index + ". " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n                index++;\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display all available roles in the system.\n     */\n    private void displayAvailableRoles() {\n        System.out.println("Available roles in the system:");\n        \n        if (availableRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("  No roles available in the system.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        int index = 1;\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n            boolean isAssigned = userRoles.contains(role);\n            String status = isAssigned ? "[ASSIGNED]" : "[AVAILABLE]";\n            System.out.println("  " + index + ". " + role.getRoleName() + \n                             " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ") " + status);\n            index++;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get roles that the administrator wants to assign to the user.\n     * \n     * @return Set of roles to assign\n     */\n    private Set<Role> getRolesToAssign() {\n        Set<Role> rolesToAssign = new HashSet<>();\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nEnter roles to ASSIGN (by ID, separated by commas, or \'none\' for none):");\n        System.out.print("Selection: ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("none") || input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles selected for assignment.");\n            return rolesToAssign;\n        }\n        \n        String[] roleIds = input.split(",");\n        for (String roleId : roleIds) {\n            roleId = roleId.trim();\n            if (!roleId.isEmpty()) {\n                Role role = findRoleById(roleId);\n                if (role != null) {\n                    // Check if role is already assigned\n                    if (targetUser.hasRole(role)) {\n                        System.out.println("  Note: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + "\' is already assigned to the user.");\n                    } else {\n                        rolesToAssign.add(role);\n                        System.out.println("  Selected to assign: " + role.getRoleName());\n                    }\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("  Warning: Role with ID \'" + roleId + "\' not found.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return rolesToAssign;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get roles that the administrator wants to remove from the user.\n     * \n     * @return Set of roles to remove\n     */\n    private Set<Role> getRolesToRemove() {\n        Set<Role> rolesToRemove = new HashSet<>();\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        if (userRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("User has no roles to remove.");\n            return rolesToRemove;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nEnter roles to REMOVE (by ID, separated by commas, or \'none\' for none):");\n        System.out.print("Selection: ");\n        String input = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        if (input.equalsIgnoreCase("none") || input.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles selected for removal.");\n            return rolesToRemove;\n        }\n        \n        String[] roleIds = input.split(",");\n        for (String roleId : roleIds) {\n            roleId = roleId.trim();\n            if (!roleId.isEmpty()) {\n                Role role = findRoleById(roleId);\n                if (role != null) {\n                    if (userRoles.contains(role)) {\n                        rolesToRemove.add(role);\n                        System.out.println("  Selected to remove: " + role.getRoleName());\n                    } else {\n                        System.out.println("  Note: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + "\' is not currently assigned to the user.");\n                    }\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("  Warning: Role with ID \'" + roleId + "\' not found.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return rolesToRemove;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Find a role by its ID in the available roles set.\n     * \n     * @param roleId The role ID to find\n     * @return The Role object if found, null otherwise\n     */\n    private Role findRoleById(String roleId) {\n        for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n            if (role.getRoleId().equals(roleId)) {\n                return role;\n            }\n        }\n        return null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Confirm the role selections with the administrator.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles selected for assignment\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles selected for removal\n     * @return true if administrator confirms, false if cancels\n     */\n    private boolean confirmSelections(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Confirm Changes ---");\n        System.out.println("Summary of changes for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        if (rolesToAssign.isEmpty() && rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No changes to make.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Roles to ASSIGN:");\n            for (Role role : rolesToAssign) {\n                System.out.println("  + " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (!rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Roles to REMOVE:");\n            for (Role role : rolesToRemove) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nConfirm these changes? (yes/no): ");\n        String response = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n        \n        return response.equalsIgnoreCase("yes") || response.equalsIgnoreCase("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Process the role changes based on administrator selections.\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles to assign\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles to remove\n     * @return true if changes were successfully processed, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean processRoleChanges(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Processing Role Changes ---");\n        \n        // Remove conflicting roles (roles both assigned and removed)\n        Set<Role> conflicts = new HashSet<>(rolesToAssign);\n        conflicts.retainAll(rolesToRemove);\n        \n        if (!conflicts.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Warning: The following roles are both assigned and removed:");\n            for (Role role : conflicts) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n            System.out.println("These roles will be processed as REMOVALS only.");\n            \n            // Remove conflicts from assignment list\n            rolesToAssign.removeAll(conflicts);\n        }\n        \n        // Process removals first\n        int removedCount = 0;\n        if (!rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            removedCount = targetUser.removeRoles(rolesToRemove);\n            System.out.println("Successfully removed " + removedCount + " role(s).");\n        }\n        \n        // Process assignments\n        int assignedCount = 0;\n        if (!rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            assignedCount = targetUser.assignRoles(rolesToAssign);\n            System.out.println("Successfully assigned " + assignedCount + " role(s).");\n        }\n        \n        // Display final result\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Final Result ---");\n        System.out.println("User: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("Total roles now assigned: " + targetUser.getRoleCount());\n        \n        Set<Role> finalRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        if (!finalRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Assigned roles:");\n            for (Role role : finalRoles) {\n                System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Simulate the "Send" button action from the use case\n        System.out.println("\\n[SIMULATION] \'Send\' button clicked - changes applied successfully.");\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Close the form and release resources.\n     */\n    public void closeForm() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n        System.out.println("Role management form closed.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validate that the role selections are valid (no duplicates in assignment,\n     * roles to remove are actually assigned, etc.).\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Roles selected for assignment\n     * @param rolesToRemove Roles selected for removal\n     * @return true if selections are valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean validateSelections(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        Set<Role> userRoles = targetUser.getRoles();\n        \n        // Check for roles to remove that aren\'t actually assigned\n        for (Role role : rolesToRemove) {\n            if (!userRoles.contains(role)) {\n                System.err.println("Validation error: Role \'" + role.getRoleName() + \n                                 "\' is not assigned to the user and cannot be removed.");\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        // Check for roles that would be both assigned and removed\n        Set<Role> intersection = new HashSet<>(rolesToAssign);\n        intersection.retainAll(rolesToRemove);\n        if (!intersection.isEmpty()) {\n            System.err.println("Validation error: The following roles are both assigned and removed:");\n            for (Role role : intersection) {\n                System.err.println("  - " + role.getRoleName());\n            }\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulate the form display without user interaction (for automated testing).\n     * \n     * @param rolesToAssign Pre-determined roles to assign\n     * @param rolesToRemove Pre-determined roles to remove\n     * @return true if changes were successfully processed, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean simulateFormSubmission(Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n*** Automated Form Submission ***");\n        System.out.println("Managing roles for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        if (!validateSelections(rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove)) {\n            System.err.println("Form submission failed: Invalid role selections.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Process the changes\n        return administrator.processRoleChanges(targetUser, rolesToAssign, rolesToRemove);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the target user of this form.\n     * \n     * @return The target user\n     */\n    public User getTargetUser() {\n        return targetUser;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Get the available roles for this form.\n     * \n     * @return Set of available roles\n     */\n    public Set<Role> getAvailableRoles() {\n        return new HashSet<>(availableRoles);\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'I have successfully created the RoleManagementForm.java class. System.out.println("---------------------------------");\n        Administrator admin = new Administrator("ADMIN003", "Charlie Brown");\n        admin.login();\n        admin.connectToSmosServer();\n        \n        // Try to execute use case with null user\n        Set<Role> roles = createSampleRoles();\n        boolean result = admin.executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(null, roles, new HashSet<>(), "SUCCESS" : "FAILED"));\n        \n        // Edge Case 3: Administrator not logged in\n        System.out.println("\\nEdge Case 3: Administrator not logged in");\n        System.out.println("-----------------------------------------");\n        admin.logout(); // Logout first\n        \n        Administrator notLoggedInAdmin = new Administrator("ADMIN004", "NotLogged");\n        // Don\'t call login() for this administrator\n        \n        result = notLoggedInAdmin.executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(testUser, roles, new HashSet<>(), new HashSet<>());\n        System.out.println("Result when admin not logged in: " + (result ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED (expected)"));\n        \n        // Edge Case 4: Duplicate role assignment\n        System.out.println("\\nEdge Case 4: Duplicate role assignment");\n        System.out.println("---------------------------------------");\n        User dupUser = new User("U004", "dup_user");\n        Role userRole = getRoleById(roles, "ROLE_USER");\n        \n        if (userRole != null) {\n            // Assign role once\n            boolean firstAssign = dupUser.assignRole(userRole);\n            System.out.println("First assignment of ROLE_USER: " + (firstAssign ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED"));\n            \n            // Try to assign the same role again\n            boolean secondAssign = dupUser.assignRole(userRole);\n            System.out.println("Second assignment of ROLE_USER: " + (secondAssign ? "SUCCESS (unexpected)" : "FAILED (expected - duplicate)"));\n            \n            System.out.println("User has " + dupUser.getRoleCount() + " roles (should be 1).");\n        }\n        \n        // Edge Case 5: Remove non-existent role\n        System.out.println("\\nEdge Case 5: Removing non-existent role");\n        System.out.println("----------------------------------------");\n        User emptyUser = new User("U005", "empty_user");\n        Role nonExistentRole = new Role("NON_EXISTENT", "Non Existent Role");\n        \n        boolean removeResult = emptyUser.removeRole(nonExistentRole);\n        System.out.println("Removing non-existent role: " + (removeResult ? "SUCCESS (unexpected)" : "FAILED (expected)"));\n        \n        // Edge Case 6: Null role handling\n        System.out.println("\\nEdge Case 6: Null role handling");\n        System.out.println("-------------------------------");\n        User nullTestUser = new User("U006", "null_test");\n        \n        // Try to assign null role\n        boolean nullAssign = nullTestUser.assignRole(null);\n        System.out.println("Assigning null role: " + (nullAssign ? successfully!");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a set of sample roles for demonstration purposes.\n     * \n     * @return Set of sample Role objects\n     */\n    private static Set<Role> Role("ROLE_USER", "Standard User"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_EDITOR", "Content Editor"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_VIEWER", "Content Viewer"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_AUDITOR", "Auditor"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_REPORTER", "Report Generator"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_MODERATOR", "Content Moderator"));\n        roles.add(new Role("ROLE_ANALYST", "Data Analyst"));\n        \n        return roles;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Helper method to find a role by ID in a set of roles.\n     * \n     * @param roles Set of roles to search\n     * @param roleId ID of the role to find\n     * @return Role object if found, null otherwise\n     */\n    private static Role getRoleById(Set<Role> roles, String roleId) {\n        if (roles == null || roleId == null) {\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        for (Role role : roles) {\n            if (role.getRoleId().equals(roleId)) {\n                return role;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays a summary of the use case requirements.\n     * This method provides documentation of the use server (postcondition for the use case).\n     */\n    public void disconnectFromSmosServer() {\n        smosServerConnected = false;\n        System.out.println("Disconnected from SMOS server.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Check if preconditions for the use case are met.\n     * Preconditions:\n     * 1. The user is logged in as an administrator\n     * 2. The user has carried out the case of use "viewdetTailsente" and the system is viewing the details of a user\n     * 3. The user click on the "User Roles" button\n     * \n     * @param targetUser The user whose details are being viewed\n     * @return true if all preconditions are met, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean checkPreconditions(User targetUser) {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.err.println("Precondition failed: Administrator is not logged in.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!smosServerConnected) {\n            System.err.println("Precondition failed: Not connected to SMOS server.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (targetUser == null) {\n            System.err.println("Precondition failed: No user details are being viewed.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Simulate that "viewdetTailsente" use case has been carried out\n        System.out.println("Preconditions met: Admin is logged in, SMOS server connected, and viewing details of user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        System.out.println("User clicked on \'User Roles\' button.");\n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Display the role management form (System action 1 from use case).\n     * This simulates displaying available roles for assignment/removal.\n     * \n     * @param availableRoles Set of all available roles in the system\n     * @param userRoles Set of roles currently assigned to the user\n     */\n    public void displayRoleManagementForm(Set<Role> availableRoles, Set<Role> userRoles) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Role Management Form ===");\n        System.out.println("Available roles in the system:");\n        \n        if (availableRoles == null || availableRoles.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No roles available in the system.");\n        } else {\n            int i = 1;\n            for (Role role : availableRoles) {\n                boolean isAssigned = userRoles.contains(role);\n                System.out.println(i + ". " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")" + \n                                   (isAssigned ? " [Currently Assigned]" : ""));\n                i++;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\nInstructions:");\n        System.out.println("1. Select roles to assign or remove (by ID or name)");\n        System.out.println("2. Click \'Send\' button to apply changes");\n        System.out.println("====================================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Process role assignments and removals (System action 4 from use case).\n     * This method handles the actual assignment and removal of roles based on administrator selection.\n     * \n     * @param targetUser The user to modify roles for\n     * @param rolesToAssign Set of roles to assign to the user\n     * @param rolesToRemove Set of roles to remove from the user\n     * @return true if operation successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean processRoleChanges(User targetUser, Set<Role> rolesToAssign, Set<Role> rolesToRemove) {\n        if (targetUser == null) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Target user is null.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if administrator is logged in and has permissions\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Administrator not logged in.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (!smosServerConnected) {\n            System.err.println("Cannot process role changes: Not connected to SMOS server.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Processing role changes for user: " + targetUser.getUsername());\n        \n        // Remove roles first to avoid conflicts\n        int removedCount = 0;\n        if (rolesToRemove != null && !rolesToRemove.isEmpty()) {\n            removedCount = targetUser.removeRoles(rolesToRemove);\n            System.out.println("Removed " + removedCount + " role(s) from user.");\n        }\n        \n        // Assign new roles\n        int assignedCount = 0;\n        if (rolesToAssign != null && !rolesToAssign.isEmpty()) {\n            assignedCount = targetUser.assignRoles(rolesToAssign);\n            System.out.println("Assigned " + assignedCount + " role(s) to user.");\n        }\n        \n        // Display final state\n        System.out.println("User now has " + targetUser.getRoleCount() + " role(s) assigned.");\n        \n        // Postcondition: User roles are modified\n        System.out.println("Postcondition satisfied: User roles have been modified.");\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Execute the complete use case "Assign/RemoveRolesToAUser".\n     * This method simulates the entire workflow described in the use case.\n     * \n     * @param targetUser The user to assign/remove roles for\n     * @param availableRoles All available roles in the system\n     * @param selectedRolesToAssign Roles selected by admin to assign\n     * @param selectedRolesToRemove Roles selected by admin to remove\n     * @return true if use case executed successfully, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean executeAssignRemoveRolesUseCase(User targetUser, Set<Role> availableRoles,\n                                                   Set<Role> selectedRolesToAssign, Set<Role> selectedRolesToRemove) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Executing Use Case: Assign/RemoveRolesToAUser ===");\n        \n        // Step 1: Check preconditions\n        if (!checkPreconditions(targetUser)) {\n            System.err.println("Use case cannot proceed: Preconditions not met.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // System action 1: Display the role management form\n        displayRoleManagementForm(availableRoles, targetUser.getRoles());\n        \n        // User action 2: Select the roles to be assigned or removed (simulated by parameters)\n        System.out.println("Administrator selected roles to assign: " + \n                          (selectedRolesToAssign != null ? selectedRolesToAssign.size() : 0) + " role(s)");\n        System.out.println("Administrator selected roles to remove: " + \n                          (selectedRolesToRemove != null ? selectedRolesToRemove.size() : 0) + " role(s)");\n        \n        // User action 3: Click on the "Send" button\n        System.out.println("Administrator clicked on \'Send\' button.");\n        \n        // System action 4: Assign or remove the user\'s roles as indicated by the administrator\n        boolean success = processRoleChanges(targetUser, selectedRolesToAssign, selectedRolesToRemove);\n        \n        if (success) {\n            // Postcondition: The administrator interrupts the connection to the SMOS server\n            disconnectFromSmosServer();\n            System.out.println("Postcondition satisfied: SMOS server connection interrupted.");\n            \n            System.out.println("=== Use Case Completed Successfully ===\\n");\n        } else {\n            System.err.println("=== Use Case Failed ===\\n");\n        }\n        \n        return success;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * View user details (simulates the "viewdetTailsente" use case System.out.println("  - " + role.getRoleName() + " (ID: " + role.getRoleId() + ")");\n            }\n        }\n        System.out.println("=============================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n
